intro: Tetrapogon roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are usually fleshy and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are typically pink or white, with four petals, and are borne in dense clusters near the base of the plant.
